text: Raymond Leo Flynn (born July 22, 1939), known as Ray Flynn, is an American politician. He served as 52nd Mayor of Boston, Massachusetts from 1984 until 1993. He was later appointed United States Ambassador to the Holy See (1993â€“1997) by President Bill Clinton. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:Living people Category:Mayors of Boston Category:Ambassadors of the United States to the Holy See Category:American Roman Catholics Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Raymond Flynn
